text: Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today I have a special guest, this is
my dad!
Papa Pizza: Hi guys!
PP: It’s good seeing you, and this is my daughter!
Ro: That’s right!

Ro: He earned the nickname of Papa Pizza, I think
I've been

Ro: calling you that since I was in middle
school, I was really really young.

Ro: And he earned this name because we used
to make pizzas together all the time.

PP: All the time, every Friday, every day
almost.

Ro: And dad used to have this awesome tomato
garden, and we would harvest

Ro: them and we’d make your pizza sauce,
your tomato sauce.

PP: Pizza sauce, tomato sauce, we had enough
for a whole year.

Ro: So, we are very lucky to have Papa Pizza
in the kitchen with us today
Ro: because, we are going to be making a pizza!

Ro: And if you can’t tell from our shirts,
we got so many requests to make
Ro: something Batman themed.

Ro: So today, we are gonna be making Batman
Pizza.
Ro: Alright Papa Pizza, let’s do this!
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of bread flour, 2 tablespoons

Ro: of olive oil, 1 package of active dry
yeast, 1-1/2 teaspoons of granulated

Ro: sugar, 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and 1
cup of water.

Ro: Then for the toppings we’re gonna be
using some black olives and
Ro: mozzarella and cheddar cheese.

PP: And for the pizza sauce you’ll need
14 ounces of tomato sauce,

PP: 1 small can of tomato paste, 1/2 cup of
water, fresh thyme, oregano and

PP: basil. 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and a head of
garlic.
Both: Now let’s put it all together!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is prepare our garlic, because it takes the longest.

PP: So what you’ll need is a cutting board,
a sharp knife, and what

PP: you’ll do is cut off the top of the
garlic.
Ro: Ooooh I can smell that!
PP: Mmmm!
Ro: That’s garlic!
PP: Oh yes!
Ro: I Like that.

PP: Then we’re gonna wrap it in aluminum
foil and drizzle it with olive oil.

PP: Now we’re gonna pop this in the oven
for 1 hour at 350 degrees.
PP: Our garlic is in the oven baking.
Ro: Mmmhmm.

PP: And we can get started on our pizza
dough.

Ro: I love this pizza dough recipe because
it is super easy mode.

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
to make our pizza dough is activate our yeast.

Ro: In a big mixing bowl combine our yeast,
sugar and 1 cup of warm water,

Ro: You want it to be about 100 degrees, we
just popped this in the microwave

Ro: for 20-30 seconds, it was the perfect
temperature.
Ro: And whisk it up!

Ro: This is perfect because I also like to
call him Whisky Whiskers!
Ro: Because he’s got the mustache!
Ro: That’s his cowboy name.
PP: That’s right, giddy-up, go!
Ro: I wish I had 1! PP: Oh, no you don’t! Ha-ha!

PP: Now we’re gonna let this sit for 2-10
minutes until bubbles start to form.

Ro: Our yeast mixture is ready, now we’re
gonna add our flour, oil and salt,
Ro: but we don’t want to add the salt first. Why’s that dad?

PP: Well that would kill the yeast, and that
would just defeat the purpose.

Ro: So we’re gonna start with oil and then
I’m gonna add about 1/2 the flour.
Ro: Sorry, little dust cloud.

Ro: After the flour has worked itself in there
a little bit, then you can add the salt.

Ro: As Papa Pizza is mixing I’ll continue to
slowly add the flour.

PP: Our dough is a little bit crumbly so I’m
gonna start kneading it in

PP: the bowl, and eventually we’re gonna
move it to the counter.

PP: OK Rosanna, I need some flour on my hands
because they’re just a little bit sticky.
Ro: OK, let me flour you, let me flour you!
PP: Thank you.
Ro: Let me flour your watch too!
PP: And my watch.
PP: It’s a water proof watch!
Ro: Dad, that’s looking pretty good!

Ro: Over here I’ve got a medium bowl, a
little bit of oil, I’m just gonna drizzle the bowl.

PP: Now you’d gonna put the dough in the
bowl and roll it around,
PP: and get oil all around it.
PP: And then we’re gonna put it to bed.

Ro: Over here, I’ve just got a little kitchen
towel, we’re just gonna tuck
Ro: him in, here we go, doo-doo-doo-doo!
PP: Yes!

Ro: And we’re gonna let it rest while we
make our pizza sauce.

PP: We’re gonna start by chopping the herbs,
it give the sauce really good flavor.

PP: And we’re gonna use about a tablespoon
of each herb.

Ro: I got a medium pot over here, scoop in
those herbs.
PP: Where does Batman raise his goldfish?
Ro: Where?
PP: In the Bat-Tub!
PP: What is Batman’s favorite fruit?
Ro: I know this one!

Both: Ba-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na
- nana!

Ro: We are gonna add our tomato sauce, pour
that in.

PP: Alright, next is our tomato paste, start
whisking, next is water.
Ro: And, I’m gonna open up our roasted garlic!
PP: Mmmm!
Ro: Fresh out of the oven.
PP: Mmmmm!
Ro: You know what I’m talking about!

Ro: And then we’re gonna squeeze the fresh
garlic into the pot.

Ro: The last ingredient for our sauce is the
salt, dad, how much do we add?

PP: Well I personally like a couple pinches,
but it’s personal preference.

PP: Now our sauce is ready, we’re gonna
take it over to the stove.

Ro: Turn the heat on the stove to medium and
bring the sauce to a simmer.

Ro: Allow the sauce to cook for an additional
5 minutes, then, turn off the
Ro: heat and set it off to the side to cool.
Ro: Now we’re gonna roll out our dough.

PP: Let’s look at it and see if it’s risen
properly.
Ro: Oh yeah!
PP: Perfect!
Ro: Boop-boop-boo!
PP: It’s ready to go!

PP: Our first step is to put a little flour
on our counter.

Ro: I’m gonna plop it over, give it a little
shake.
PP: Oh, oh yeah, perfect!

PP: And I begin to roll it out, different
directions to try to keep that
PP: same circle shape.
Ro: Yeah!
PP: Ah, magnifique!

PP: OK, our pizza looks about the right
shape, let’s put it on the pan and see.
PP: Fold it in 1/2…

Ro: Lift it Papa Pizza, lift it and I’ll
go under.
PP: OK here we go!
Ro: OK, OK, OK!

Ro: I like to use my hands to just make it
the same shape and size of the pan.
PP: The next step is to poke little air holes.

Ro: The little holes prevent getting big bubbles
while it’s baking.
PP: Now let’s put on the sauce.

Ro: And we’re gonna leave some room for
the crust.
About 1-1/2” all the way around.

Ro: You got any tips for not eating the whole
thing right now?
PP: No!

Ro: We’re gonna pop this into the oven at
450 degrees and bake for 5 minutes.
Ro: Now we’re gonna prepare our toppings.
PP: And in front of us we have cheese.
Ro: Mmmmhmmm.
PP: And olives.
Ro: Papa Pizza’s gonna be grating the cheeses.

PP: Using the large grate and keeping the
cheeses separate.

Ro: I’m gonna chop up the olives nice and
fine.
Ro: I love these!
Ro: Olive me! Loves olive you!
Ro: That’s a song…
PP: Well that’s special.

Ro: Papa Pizza, how’s the cheese looking
over there?
PP: It’s looking very grate!
Ro: Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Ro:I get it!
Ro: I was not expecting that!

Ro: Our pizza is fresh out of the oven, I
gave it a few minutes to cool down

Ro: because I didn’t want it to be too hot
to touch.

Ro: And now, we are gonna decorate, this is
the fun part!

Ro: We are gonna start with, I found this
Batman big cookie cutter online,

Ro: If you’re interested in getting one
of these, I’ll put a link down below.

Ro: But you can also freehand, I’ve done
that as well.

Ro: So I’m just gonna place the cookie cutter
down into the middle of the pizza.

Ro: Take your chopped olives, pinch it into
the middle of your cookie cutter.
Ro: Leave the cookie cutter in place.
PP: That’s right.

Ro: And then we’re gonna eyeball it, using
our cheddar cheese, we are gonna

Ro: make an oval around the bat, so it looks
like the batman logo.

Ro: Very gently and carefully pick up the
cookie cutter just know that you
Ro: might have to adjust the edges.

PP: And once your Batman logo looks good it’s
time to start with the mozzarella.
Ro: We’re gonna be filling in the mozzarella from the edge of the cheddar to about 1/2 an
Ro: inch over the pizza sauce line.

Ro: Our pizza is all decorated, and now we’re
ready to bake it for the second
Ro: and final time!

PP: Pop it in the oven at 350 degrees for
8-10 minutes.

PP: And when you’re waiting for your pizza
to bake it seems like its forever!

Ro: Don’t worry Dad, I got something to
pass the time, I got a little game!
Ro: WHERE’S THE JOKER!?
PP: WHERE’S THE PENGUIN!?
PP: I AM BAT-DAD!

PP: SOME MEN JUST WANT TO WATCH THE PIZZA
BURN!
RO: BUT NOT US!
Both: WE LOVE PIZZA!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here is the Batman Themed Pizza that we
made today!

Ro: A big thank you to you guys for suggesting
something Batman Themed!

Ro: And, a big thank you to my Dad, Papa Pizza,
for helping me today!

PP: Oh you’re welcome, whenever you do pizza
just call me!

Ro: He’s the right guy to help you with
a pizza.

Ro: I’ll be posting the recipe and lots
of pictures on RosannaPansino.com,

Ro: Instagram, Facebook and Twitter, so you
can check them out there.

Ro: And if you guys make this pizza, please
take a picture and send it to me,

Ro: I love seeing your creations, and I’ll
show Papa Pizza!
PP: I’d love to see those pictures!

Ro: And if you guys have any other ideas for
any other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my
Ro: best to make it happen!
Ro: Alright Thanks you guys, bye-bye!
PP: Bye everyone!
PP: Alright, can we eat this now?
Ro: Yeah, we can eat this now!

Ro: Time for a hard earned piece of pizza,
we did it, cheers!
PP: Cheers!
Ro: Yeah!
Ro: Mmmmmm!
Ro: HITS THE SPOT!
Ro: Would you say this is Papa Pizza Approved?
PP: Papa Pizza Approved!
Ro: Huuuhhhh!
Ro: Bye-bye!
